definition: to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions

sentences.english: What makes me uncomfortable is that this after he has endured so much, the country has at last harmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我難受的，是這個國家終於傷害到了百般隱忍的他。

sentences.english: Thy sovranty , recoiling with a blow.
sentences.chinese: 因突遭一擊而退縮隱忍。

sentences.english: All the days before tomorrow, I will love you, to endure silently.
sentences.chinese: 明天之前的每一天，我都會隱忍地愛着你。

sentences.english: Most of the persons aboard are under hidden tears while doing their work.
sentences.chinese: 船上很多人在工作時默默隱忍着淚水。

sentences.english: Tolerance desolation under the breaking out of a two three chapters.
sentences.chinese: 隱忍下的蒼涼開出一朵兩朵三朵斷章。

sentences.english: His first wife spent twenty years enduring and forgiving his infidelities .
sentences.chinese: 連理廿載，他的髮妻都用來隱忍，原諒他的不忠了。

sentences.english: Have a kind of eternity is actually contain a kind of strength.
sentences.chinese: 有一種隱忍其實是蘊藏着的一種力氣。

sentences.english: Did not think of two people bear long already amour to erupt immediately, instantly lightning marriage.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到兩人隱忍已久的戀情頓時爆發，立即閃電結婚。

sentences.english: To my mind, as long as I could get married with jack, I did not care whether he had had some love affairs with other women.
sentences.chinese: 只要能和安傑結婚，他的豔遇，我可以隱忍。

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
